alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 14 at 12:19PM EST until January 17 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. Minor to moderate coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...Rip current ris from 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ this morning through late Sunday night. Coastal Flood Watch From Saturday evening through Sunday evening. Peak water levels are possible around the time of high tide very early Sunday morning, between 1 AM and 3 AM. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Water levels are anticipated to be highest from Saint Teresa Beach to Alligator Point. In these areas, several roads along the coast could flood, becoming impassible. Structures not elevated on Bald Point or Alligator Point could flood. Minor flooding is possible in Apalachicola where some low lying streets could flood.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
